Title: c-icap: Denial of service
Synopsis: A vulnerability in c-icap could result in Denial of Service.

Background.Text: c-icap is an implementation of an ICAP server. It can be used with HTTP proxies that support the ICAP protocol to implement content adaptation and filtering services.

Description.Text: c-icap contains a flaw in the parse_request() function of request.c that may allow a remote denial of service. The issue is triggered when the buffer fails to contain a ‘ ‘ or ‘?’ symbol, which will cause the end pointer to increase and surpass allocated memory. With a specially crafted request (e.g. via the OPTIONS method), a remote attacker can cause a loss of availability for the program.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker may cause a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All c-icap users should upgrade to the latest version:
